wikipedia_page.main: Helen Elizabeth Bailey (22 August 1964 – c. 11 April 2016) was a British author who wrote the Electra Brown series of books aimed at a teenage audience.She was reported missing in April 2016; three months later on 15 July, her remains were found hidden at her home. Her partner, Ian Stewart, was charged with her murder and found guilty in February 2017; he was later charged with the death of his first wife, Diane.

response: * British author Helen Bailey was a resident of the town at the time of her murder in April 2016. "Concern grows for missing author Helen Bailey", BBC News, 17 April 2016. Retrieved 11 July 2016

*Helen Bailey, 51, British author, suffocated.Helen Bailey death: Family members pay tribute after author's body is discovered buried next to her dog

link_mentions.page: List of solved missing person cases: post-2000
response: |The British writer of children's and teenage fiction was reported missing after allegedly taking her dog for a walk in Royston, Hertfordshire, England, in April 2016. No trace of her was found initially, but in July 2016 her remains (and the dog's) were found in a cesspit under the garage of her home and her partner was charged with her murder."Helen Bailey death: Partner charged with murdering children's author", BBC News, 16 July 2016. Retrieved July 16, 2016
Helen Bailey was an eight-year-old schoolgirl who was killed near her home in Great Barr, Birmingham, England, on 10 August 1975.
